reviews.text: When was you not allowed on the platform to say good bye to loved ones . I have not been on a train for decades but wanted to see my daughter off on holiday , your no longer allowed with out a ticket , surely they can do guest tickets for 1/2 hour to say good bye. , station looked clean what few staff I seen was just busy chatting with each other .
I loved watching the semaphore signals still operating on main line railway

Train station could do with some hanging baskets or some flowers to Brighton it up.  Like st Austell have dun. Is clean and tidy mind and the staff are always willing to help and friendly.. was a little disappointed that the public toilets was closed for refurb but i suppose that couldn't be helped apart from that.. top job.
A few rude and unfriendly staff lower a generally good customer service level. Treat customers who need assistance as an inconvenience. Can usually find them stood in the foyer on the phones

I am a frequent traveler, using this station regularly. Not to forget using it for work from Falmouth to Truro . The staff on the train and at the station, always freindly smiling and helpful. 

The other day I left my card holder with my season ticket, Railcard, staff card, and Credit card  behind on the train. 

The staff were quick to recognise me. Put it away  for safe keeping . They then informed  one of  comy work colleagues who was able to get a message to my section.  I cannot thank them enough for their prompt action.
